availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James A. Cook (Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer)

body.p: Caldwell County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Lydia Pettit Cook. Father of Mary E. "Mittie" Cook and John Cook. Married to Adeline Pettit Cook in Caldwell County, Kentucky, on February 14, 1865. Farmer in Caldwell County in 1860. Employed J. J. Chambers as an overseer in Caldwell County in 1860. Owned thirty-one enslaved persons in Caldwell County in 1860. Held seven enslaved persons in trust for J. W. Cook in Caldwell County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 41.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 223B.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Caldwell County, Princeton, p. 504B.
"James A. Cook (1833-1907)," Find A Grave, Memorial #197658332, accessed November 3, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/197658332.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Caldwell County Marriages, Film #000546374.
